text: Pseudomonas hot-foot syndrome is a self-limited cutaneous condition that occurs on the plantar surface of children after swimming in pool water that has high concentrations of P. aeruginosa.http://content.nejm.org/cgi/content/full/345/5/335 The condition typically presents as plantar purple-red nodules. == See also == * Pseudomonal pyoderma * List of cutaneous conditions == References == Category:Bacterium- related cutaneous conditions
title: Pseudomonas hot-foot syndrome
